text: Robert Emmet Finnigan (May 27, 1927August 14, 2022) was an American chemist. He was known for his role in the creation of gas chromatographyâ€“mass spectrometry equipment. Finnigan founded the Scientific Instruments Division of Electronic Associates, Inc.. His works had also helped with the monitoring of water quality and pollution. Finnigan died on August 14, 2022 at his house in Palo Alto, California, at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American chemists Category:Scientists from Buffalo, New York
title: Robert E. Finnigan
